272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:31): hey david

0871b7a95f42418fd5e356807b8837cc (02:32): gman: what's the status these days on making gdm the default?
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:33): comay, i know the functionality is more or less par with dtlogin
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:33): Gman: can I select ja_JP.PCK as locale in gdm ?
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:34): if you select 'Japanese'
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:34): gdm on Solaris only believes in UTF-8 & GB18030 locales
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:34): alanc: that is unfortunate
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:35): that was the requirement from our i18n & l10n teams
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:35): they're working to EOF the legacy non-Unicode locales
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:35): Gman: I suggest to add ja_JP.PCK and a bunch of other locales, otherwise you may get an escalation after Neveda FCS is out... ;-(
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:35): alanc: that is likely not going to happen in the next ten years... ;-(
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:35): i'll leave that to the teams who know what they're doing ;)
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:36): comay: the last major holdup for gdm as default is lack of "Command Line Login" option, for which they're waiting on the virtual console project
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:36): nrubsig: talk to the i18n community about that
30304b9bc0a292e1440982ddf6a0c186 (02:37): virtual console project - that will probably allow the "switch user" feature, too?
30304b9bc0a292e1440982ddf6a0c186 (02:37): hmm.. will there be some transition guide from dtlogin session profiles to gdm sessions?
0871b7a95f42418fd5e356807b8837cc (02:38): alanc: thanks.  i was wondering if the command line login was the holdup
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:38): (though virtual consoles will only be on x86 and very limited sparc hardware)
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:38): there were a bunch of others, but they've been addressed by GNOME 2.14

d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:39): still need to get Sun Ray to support it, but Sun Ray has plenty of time to do that before Nevada ships, and they already support gdm in their Linux release, so it won't be too hard
316982397a0e69355664adb9941f9144 (02:39): what's wrong with dtlogin?
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:39): Error_404: CDE bad.
30304b9bc0a292e1440982ddf6a0c186 (02:39): though gdm with its import-all-gnome-already is not much better
316982397a0e69355664adb9941f9144 (02:40): dtlogin throws me straight in to gnome/jds
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:40): it's incompatible with accessibility technology for one thing, which is required by many governments and private businesses now
30304b9bc0a292e1440982ddf6a0c186 (02:40): absolutely no need to run a low memory desktop with such a huge beast in the background (yes, I'm exaggerating - a bit)
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:40): the latest gdm brings in a significantly lower set of libs
177a0408d8bdd3bdb2f906f319e3d5bb (02:41): is Xgl possable on solaris??
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:41): Gman: gdm is still a memory hog compared to both dtlogin, kdm and xdm
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:41): report bugs
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:41): it's just an OpenGL client that sits on top of a normal Xserver - a overpowered Xnest
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:42): Gman: what should I write ? gdm comsumes more memory than kdm ?
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:42): The response may be interesting...
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:42): 'how much memory does kdm consume'
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:42): what does it link against?
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:42): how big are those libraries?
cda365fefc1c0c3a4e5c1dd9770f4c09 (02:42): I didn't have much luck running Xgl on top of Xsun .. certain GL extensions were lacking
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:42): what is the feature comparison?
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:43): making it a gnome vs kde pissing match isn't going to be very productive
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (02:43): i'd suggest you talk to yippi - he's the gdm maintainer, and usually receptive to complaints
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:44): oh, I don't know about that - never tried it myself
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (02:49): nrubsig had an old Xgl mostly running on Xsun about a year and a half ago, but that was before they started using these new GL extensions
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:49): alanc: you can downgrade that quite easily.
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:51): more interestingly is the idea to run Xgl with Xgl
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:52): ATI has a cool bug which causes their GL pipeline on almost all chips to overflow and hang the machine hard
0871b7a95f42418fd5e356807b8837cc (02:52): one thing i like about dtlogin is the remote login facility - gdm always seem to insist on doing a broadcast for on-subnet machines
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:52): comay: I wish gdm and kdm would have an easy way to filter the list via a GUI...
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:53): I am always seeing all 400 machines when I try to login into machines via the XDM way
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:53): and that sucks
0871b7a95f42418fd5e356807b8837cc (02:53): yes.  in my case, i just want a dialog box that requests the host i want to login to.
0871b7a95f42418fd5e356807b8837cc (02:54): but perhaps there is something in the gdm preferences/settings to do this
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:54): I do not need preferences
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:54): I need a filter widget in the GUI...
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:55): ksh93-integration 2006-08-05 tarballs are OUT!
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:58): http://www.opensolaris.org/os/project/ksh93-integration/downloads/2006-08-27/
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:59): jbalint: now includes 64bit binaries, too.
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (02:59): jbalint: and /sbin/ksh93 which means: No longer suffering from /sbin/sh when /usr isn't mounted.
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (03:00): but it's so much fun to have to use 'echo *' to list files when you can get to /usr/bin/ls !
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:01): stevel: ping!
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:01): stevel: what is that SCM management link on the project homepage ?
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (03:02): at the moment, a broken link
92a2971947f98559b55851639c206ff3 (03:03): i can install this right over the old one, right?
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (03:03): once we roll out the SCM beta, it will take you to the repository management webapp
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:07): comay, mail <email/> - i'm sure he'll get back quickly
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:08): nrubsig, a filter option sounds like a useful feature, mail brian :)
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:13): always good to have brian focused on his next set of tasks too ;)
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:14): any opensolaris-announce admins here ?
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:15): nrubsig, yeah, i have a global password
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:15): you need moderating?
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:15): Gman: there is a ksh93-integrated related annoucement
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:16): ok, will check
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:16): Gman: just approve it
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:16): Gman: thanks
ee0a31ca605f8d965931c8adb3ac129e (03:19): Gman: hey, who works with authentication stuff?
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:20): authentication in what sense?
ee0a31ca605f8d965931c8adb3ac129e (03:20): well, we have an issue with authentication for PostgreSQL on Solaris
ee0a31ca605f8d965931c8adb3ac129e (03:21): namely that there's no way to do safe passwordless authentication
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:22): usually the gnome folk go talking to people like darren moffat and wyllis ingersoll
272c868dbdbed152063a7bcfe7b75482 (03:22): though i imagine sommerfeld might be a good source too :)
0e60fa2a21b13bc3d41902ac2acd28e3 (03:22): I'd hassle sommerfeld first, actually

d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (03:23): that sounds like something you need to talk to PostgreSQL people about though - don't they provide their own auth mechanisms and not use Solaris facilities like PAM?
0e60fa2a21b13bc3d41902ac2acd28e3 (03:23): only because I've had more interaction with him than Darren or Wyllis
d151ca693f617f47c68797c351f1495e (03:23): oh, I hadn't looked up his real name and didn't recognize the nick
ee0a31ca605f8d965931c8adb3ac129e (03:24): alanc: generally users do it via IDENT
ee0a31ca605f8d965931c8adb3ac129e (03:24): but Solaris doesn't support IDENT
